title: Establishes the power authority of the state of New York shall make low cost hydropower available to certain hospitals
summary: Establishes the power authority of the state of New York shall make low cost hydropower available to hospitals located within the counties of Niagara and Orleans.

       AN  ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to establishing
         the power authority of the state of  New  York  shall  make  low  cost

   16  for  replacement  or  preservation power allocations as provided in this
   17  subdivision. If such power is not allocated within such period it  shall
   18  be allocated for the purpose of energy cost savings benefits pursuant to
   19  subdivision  (h)  of  section  one  hundred eighty-three of the economic
   20  development law. The authority shall negotiate contracts  on  reasonable
   21  terms  and  conditions to renew or extend every permanent contract allo-
   22  cation of expansion power in effect on the effective date of this subdi-
   23  vision and, to the extent consistent with such contracts, the  authority
   24  shall  negotiate  contracts on reasonable terms and conditions to extend
   25  or renew all other allocations or allotments of such power in effect  on
   26  such  date.  The authority shall negotiate contracts on reasonable terms

   31  terms on or before the end of  the  initial  federal  energy  regulatory
   32  commission  license for the Niagara project; provided that, in negotiat-
   33  ing the terms and  conditions  of  such  contracts,  the  authority  may
   34  consider  a  business'  compliance  with  all  current contractual obli-
   35  gations, including employment and  power  usage  commitments.  Contracts
   36  entered  into  pursuant  to  this  subdivision  shall contain reasonable
   37  provisions providing for the partial or complete withdrawal of the power
   38  in the event the recipient fails to maintain mutually agreed  levels  of
   39  employment,  investment, and power utilization. Expansion or replacement
   40  power relinquished by businesses or withdrawn by the authority shall  be
   41  allocated  directly or by sale for resale by the authority to businesses
   42  within the state located within thirty  miles  of  the  Niagara  project
   43  provided,  that the proceeds from the sale of such unallocated and allo-
   44  cated, but relinquished or withdrawn or currently not accessed expansion
   45  or replacement power, as shall be determined by the trustees,  shall  be
   46  allocated for the purposes of western New York economic development fund
   47  benefits  pursuant  to  the  eleventh  undesignated  paragraph  of  this
   48  section. Proceeds to such western New  York  economic  development  fund
   49  shall  not  preclude the authority from allocating expansion or replace-
   50  ment power to eligible companies under the provisions of  this  section.
   51  The  amount  of  power  allocated  to businesses in Chautauqua county on
   52  January first, nineteen hundred eighty-seven shall be allocated in  such
   53  county.  Preservation  power that is relinquished by businesses or with-
   54  drawn by the authority shall be allocated directly or by sale for resale
   55  by the authority within the counties of Jefferson,  Saint  Lawrence  and
   56  Franklin.   Allocations made pursuant to this paragraph shall be made in
